thread.title: Tencent shares slide after revenue miss and margin warning

title: Tencent shares slide after revenue miss and margin warning
text: March 22, 2018 / 4:08 AM / Updated 15 minutes ago Tencent shares slide after revenue miss and margin warning Reuters Staff 1 Min Read HONG KONG (Reuters) - Shares of China’s Tencent Holdings fell as much as 4.6 percent on Thursday after the internet giant’s results announced a day earlier showed that revenue missed estimates and it warned that planned investments may hurt margins. FILE PHOTO: A sign of Tencent is seen during the third annual World Internet Conference in Wuzhen town of Jiaxing, Zhejiang province, China November 16, 2016. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo Tencent shares fell to as low as HK$441.4 in morning trading. The company posted on Wednesday a 98 percent jump in quarterly net profit, beating estimates, though revenue grew slower than expected at 51 percent. With a market capitalization of around $535 billion, Tencent is Asia’s most valuable listed company and the world No.5 behind Apple, Alphabet, Amazon.com and Microsoft. Company president Martin Lau warned at a briefing on Wednesday that the company plans to invest “aggressively” in areas including video and payment, which may hurt margins. Reporting by Sijia Jiang; Editing by Muralikumar Anantharaman
